page.title: 12A SOUTH HAM FARMER'S YEAR
page.content: This describes a year in the life of a farm,with a dairy herd of 330 Friesian cows,a flock of about 300 sheep,and some 960 acres of land. {January}:Calves born in the previous two seasons are wintered indoors and have to be fed.Dairy herd are milked and tended (also indoors).Preparations are made for lambing. {February}:As January,plus fencing and preparing the pasture for the cattle. End of this month _ lambing begins. {March}:As always the dairy herd are looked after.The cattle are got ready to go out to graze,this involves drenching and worming.Lambing is fully underway:as they are born all lambs are tailed and the males castrated by ringing.Summer barley and other crops are sown. Continued page 13.
